Transcript:
Olivia: Wow. This is a perfect copy of my 
necklace. You really outdid yourself, Mr. Carson.

Phillip: Oh, I was just looking to see... 
you're not wearing that necklace that I got you.

Olivia: No, no, I'm having it cleaned. If I'd known you were coming home, I 
would have picked it up. You caught me off-guard. Thanks for getting it to me so 
quickly. It really was an emergency.

Jeweler: I'm glad you're pleased with it, 
Mrs. Spaulding. Wear it in good health.

Phillip: Pardon me. That beautiful diamond 
necklace you just gave that woman. Did you make it?
Jeweler: Stunning, isn't it?
Phillip: Mm-hmm.
Jeweler: You'd never guess it was a fake.
Phillip: Yeah, you're right. I never would.

Bill: I do not want you to even look at that suitcase again, okay? Come here. 
All right. Now, look, there's something I've got to go take care of right now, 
okay? But when I get back, I want talk more about this, okay?
Eden: Where are you going, honey?
Bill: I just have to go.
Eden no, no, no. Where... no.

Bill: All right, listen to me. If you must know, okay, I will tell you. I'm 
going to go pick up a bottle of wine, I'm going to go pick up some dinner from 
towers and we are going to have our own little candlelight dinner right here.
Eden: Okay.
Bill: Happy? Surprise ruined.
Eden: Don't be long.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Robbie: When is daddy coming home?

Michelle: I'm not sure, sweetie. You know those men that were here earlier 
tonight? They played a mean trick on us by messing up our house, so daddy is 
playing a trick back on them. We just have to hope that he does a really good 
job of pretending and fools them really, really well.
Danny: You want me to kill Eden august?

Salerno: The chick stole from me, Danny. She flushed my dope down the toilet. 
What, am I supposed to turn a blind eye?
Danny: No.

Salerno: No. Just like I can't let one of my guys refuse an order. There are 
rules. Keeping my house in order is as important to me as your family is to you.

Danny: Are you saying that if I don't kill 
Eden, you'll come after my wife and kid?

Salerno: Danny, it pains me to even think of 
it, but we've all got to follow the rules.

Danny: Vinnie, you have my loyalty, you know that. But we have a deal. If you so 
much as touch a hair on Michelle or Robbie’s head...

Salerno: Come on, Danny. Danny, Danny, why would I do that? We're one big family 
here. Same goals, same dreams. You said you would do anything to work your way 
back into the business. I'm just giving you a chance to prove it. Go home, think 
about it, all right? Call me back tonight. Say hello to that lovely wife for me.
Tony: Danny?
Danny: Hey.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Olivia: Hi, it's Olivia. Did any more stock go on sale before the market closed 
today? Yeah, I know what you said. I was just hoping that... (Sighs) well, I'm 
going to have to get it some other way. Well, somebody's figured it out because 
they're snatching it up before I can. No, I have a pretty good idea who it is. 
Look, I'm getting another call, okay? I have to go. Bye. Hello?
Phillip: Hi. It's your husband.
Olivia: Phillip, hi.
Phillip: Where are you?
Olivia: At the beacon. Why?

Phillip: Oh, that's perfect. Why don't you 
meet me at the bar in a half an hour-- the one with your name on it?
Olivia: What's going on?

Phillip: Oh, you know, I'm just... I'm tired of this tension between us. Why 
don't we have some dinner, a little wine, try to reconnect, see if we can't 
remember all the things that are right between us and why we fell in love in the 
first place. What do you say?

Olivia: Sounds lovely. But I don't think I can take a break. You know, I have 
all this paperwork that I need to catch up on. I've been avoiding it for weeks.

Phillip: Oh, that's too bad. Actually, I was sort of hoping to discuss a little 
business with you about Spaulding as we go down the line, and your ongoing role 
with the company, but that's okay. We can do it another time.

Olivia: No, if it's that important to you, I 
can put my paperwork off for another day.
Phillip: Are you sure?

Olivia: Positive. I'll meet you in a half an 
hour.
Phillip: Great. Can't wait.
Olivia: Me, too. Bye.
Phillip: Bye.

Olivia: A little wine, a little dinner. What 
are you doing, Phillip?
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Josh: Hey. Excuse me. I was under the impression you moved out of this house. 
You want to give me your keys right now?

Shayne: No, thank you. What happens if I get 
a little hungry and there's no food in our fridge.

Josh: Oh, yeah. That's the only reason to 
come over here now, right? To eat?
Shayne: Well, actually not this time.

Sandy: No, no, no. This time it's all about the never-ending move. I thought 
women were bad with the stuff, but this guy is the worst.

Shayne: Hey, hey. It's sports equipment, 
okay? It's sports equipment. Dad?
Josh: Yeah?

Shayne: I hope you didn't throw out those 
boxes of old mitts and bats that I have in the back of my closet.

Josh: No, no. Of course we didn't throw that stuff out. Your mother's going to 
turn all that stuff into the Shayne lewis shrine one day, I'm sure. She's 
feeling a little sentimental these days.

Shayne: Well, she can have it all after the summer's over. I need all the stuff 
for the fifth street baseball summer program.. some of the kids can't afford 
equipment, so I'm going to bring my old stuff.

Josh: That's great. That's very nice of you. 
I guess the shrine is going to have to wait, then.

Shayne: And you can actually hang out until I 
figure out how many boxes there are.
Josh: (Laughs)
Sandy: Can I?
Shayne: Yes, you may. What is this?

Josh: I think they're... it's from Paris. I 
think they're gifts from your sister.
Sandy: Ooh. Did Marah send us anything?

Josh: I don't know. I think it's mostly 
wedding presents for bill and Eden.

Sandy: Ah, the wedding. My first big family 
wedding.
Josh: Ooh, lucky you.

Shayne: Well, see, usually it's daddy and 
mommy getting married.

Josh: Yeah, well, this time it happens to be 
bill and Eden’s turn.
Shayne: Hm. (Knocking on door)
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Bill: Salerno! Open up!
Tony: Oh, bill, bill.

Bill: My goodness. Why does it not surprise me that you're here, huh? Your boss 
around? Never mind, I'll find out myself.
Tony: This is a private club, bill.
Bill: Tony.

Tony: Don't do this. Not now. Do you 
understand that? Don't do this. I'm telling you.

Bill: Listen, I told half the town I'm coming 
over here, so if anything happens to me...

Tony: If anything happens to you, bill, it's 
because you asked for it. I'm not here to help, all right?

Salerno: It's all right, Antonio. Let Mar 
Lewis in.
Tony: Go ahead.
Salerno: So, what's on your mind, Bill?
Bill: Eden. I want you to stay away from her.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Harley: Hey, Eden. I thought we could go over 
some wedding plans.

Eden: It's okay. Bill's not here. He's out 
getting us dinner or stewing, or both.
Harley: Did you guys have a fight?

Eden: He saw how anxious I was and his mind immediately went to Salerno. But I 
convinced him it was just pre-wedding jitters. I think.
Harley: Are you sure?
Eden: Yeah.

Harley: I just mean, if bill didn't buy your story, if he goes and confronts 
Salerno, I mean, given what you just did to the guy...
Eden: O’Neill told you?

Harley: O’Neill told me. And we are really 
concerned about your safety, Eden.
Eden: I'm concerned about my safety.

Harley: Okay. O’Neill has assigned you a 
bodyguard. Me. You okay with that?

Eden: Are you kidding? I would have you move in here, but bill would get 
suspicious. Oh, Harley, I hate lying to him.

Harley: I know. I've been doing a lot of 
lying to your brother the last few days.

Eden: More than the last few days. You thought for a while I was involved with 
Vinnie's drug operation. Why didn't you say anything to Nicky?
Harley: I wanted to wait until I was sure.
Eden: And now that you are?

Harley: Let's just get through what's in 
front of us. Okay? And then we'll see where it stands.
Eden: Okay. (Knock on door)

Harley: Go in the back room and be very 
quiet.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Danny: Hey. Where's Robbie?
Michelle: He's upstairs. Is everything okay?

Danny: Michelle, I'm sorry. We have to get 
Robbie out of town.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Sandy: So, brother, you sure you don't need 
my help up there?

Shayne: That's quite all right. The guy has 
questions about everything and he screws up my process.

Josh: Oh, that's a terrible thing, isn't it? 
Your brother wanting to know more about you.

Shayne: I'm going to holler when I need some 
muscle, okay?

Sandy: All right. You see, that's pretty 
cool, seeing him fly around like that.

Josh: Yes, it is. That's how he was as a kid, you know? He never walked 
anywhere. He always ran or galloped or whatever. And of course, all that 
stopped.
Sandy: But now he's back.
Josh: Yes.
Sandy: In full effect.
Josh: And you had a lot to do with that.
Sandy: Me?

Josh: Yeah. You've been a good brother to 
him.
Sandy: Well, he's been a great brother to me.

Josh: I think it was a good thing for him to have somebody around that needed 
him at a time when he felt so helpless. A lot of us... I was guilty of this, you 
know? We got so focused on trying to get him to walk again that we sort of 
suffocated him, made him feel like he didn't have any purpose. But you helped 
him. That's why I'M... especially now that Marah's not around, I'm glad that 
you're here for him.
Sandy: Well, thank you, josh.

Josh: It's funny how things work out, isn't it? I was just thinking about how 
when we first found out about you, I wasn't quite sure that you were going to 
fit into this family.
Sandy: Yeah. Now?

Josh: Oh, now you're stuck with us, (Laughs) whether you like it or not. You are 
a full-fledged member of this family now.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Harley: Sorry. I bet you're wondering what 
I'm doing with my gun out.

Gus: No, I know what you're doing. You're 
protecting Eden. I know what's going on with Salerno.
Eden: You know?

Gus: Yeah. He's on a rage. He's on a tear. Nobody on the street knows exactly 
what put him there, but anybody who's been connected to him is beating it out of 
town, but quick.

Harley: But they don't know who really set 
him off? I mean, that's what I hear.

Gus: Yeah. They don't know. You have nothing to worry about, though, because 
whatever it is, it's business-related.
Eden: I know. I just...

Gus: You just got a little scared. Right? You 
called your girl here. But you should have called your big brother.

Harley: She didn't call me. I heard rumblings about Salerno on the street, so I 
came here to fill her in and see if she was okay.

Gus: Really? Well, that makes you lucky, doesn't it? I mean, not only do you 
have a bridesmaid, but you got yourself a bodyguard. (Laughs)
Eden: Yeah, I'm pretty lucky all right.
Gus: Yeah.
Eden: Yeah.

Gus: You got nothing to worry about, honey, because whoever Salerno is after, 
like I said, it's business-related. But that's a good thing because whenever he 
finds whoever it is he's looking for, it isn’t going to be pretty.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Salerno: Why don't you guys go occupy yourselves? Tony, go with them. I didn't 
catch what you were saying there, Bill.

Bill: Look, Vinnie-- may I call you Vinnie? All right, look, I know that you and 
Eden knew each other a while ago. Okay, I don't know what the relationship was 
and, really, I don't care. But what I do know is that she is with me now, and 
she is going to be my wife. And she is the toughest, bravest woman that I know, 
but lately, for some reason, the mere mention of your name puts her in a real 
state. Okay? She is scared.
Salerno: Scared of me? Did she say why?
Bill: No.
Salerno: You sure?

Bill: Yes, I'm sure. But you sound like you 
know the reason why. So, why don't you fill me in?
Michelle: Did something happen with Salerno?
Danny: No.
Michelle: Did he threaten Robbie?
Danny: No, Michelle.
Michelle: Then why would you say that?

Danny: It's nothing like that. I'm just... I'm getting a feeling, that's all. 
I'm getting a feeling that things are coming to a head. Vinnie's in a rage.

Michelle: Yeah, no kidding, Danny. The way he 
sent those thugs here to destroy our home.

Danny: Michelle, he thinks that someone stole 
from him and double-crossed him.

Michelle: But he knows it wasn't you now, 
right?

Danny: Yeah, he does, but Michelle, he's not thinking straight and if he goes 
off again, I don't want him or his thugs coming back into our house.
Michelle: Or coming after our son.

Danny: Right. How was Robbie when Salerno's 
guys were here? Was he... was he upset? Was he afraid?

Michelle: I told him that the grownups were all playing a game and he could 
play, too, by going up into his room and hiding. So he wasn't really here for 
most of it.

Danny: Good. Michelle, there can't be a next time. There can’t. Honey, we've 
done everything we can to protect ourselves and the people we care about. We got 
your father out of town. We got Nico out of here. We've pushed everyone else 
away. But we knew that this was coming. I'm sorry. Robbie cannot stay with us 
right now. It's not safe. I'm sorry. I am. I'm really sorry.
Michelle: What are we supposed to do, Danny?

Danny: I called Rick. And it turns out that Mel is leaving town tonight with 
Leah and Jude to visit some relatives and your uncle mike is her first stop. She 
agreed to take Robbie with her. Is that okay with you?
Michelle: What reason did you give them?
Danny: I didn’t. They didn't ask.

Michelle: Danny, what is really going on? 
Just tell me what this is about.

Danny: Michelle, we have to keep Robbie safe. We have to. We have no choice. 
Honey, I know how hard this is for you, but it's hard for me. It is. But we have 
to do this. We're doing the right thing. You have been so strong and I can't 
tell you how much I appreciate that. You've stood by me every step of the way 
through this.
Michelle: I always will, okay?

Danny: Really? You'll always love me? 
Michelle? No matter what happens?
Michelle: Of course I will.
Danny: Okay.

Michelle: Oh, Danny, just tell me. Please, 
just tell me what's wrong. Please.

Danny: It's just this whole thing is getting 
to me. It's getting to me. It's driving me nuts!
Michelle: Are you sure that's all it is.
Danny: Yeah.
Michelle: Really?

Danny: That's it. We have to do this. You know what we have to do. Mel's going 
to be here soon. We've got to get Robbie ready to go.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Phillip: She had the necklace copied, Alan. Yeah. The real one? Well, I would 
imagine the real one was sold because she needed to raise some cash, fast, 
because she's the one who's been buying up our stock. No, we don't want to stop 
her. Let her keep on doing exactly what she's doing for right now, because if 
the feds manage to pin something on us, somebody's going to have to take the 
fall. And alas, with great power comes great responsibility. Well, my focus is 
on eliminating anything that can harm my children. Anything and anyone. I have 
to go. My loving wife is waiting. Bye. I am so glad that you could take a break. 
I think this will be great for both of us. I see you're wearing the necklace I 
gave you.
Olivia: Yeah, of course I am.

Phillip: Boy, they really did clean it up. 
Look how it sparkles. It almost doesn't look like the same piece.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Gus: So?
Harley: So?

Gus: Do you know something I don't know? Is Eden the one Salerno is after? I 
mean, you came all the way down here.
Harley: Yeah. To put her mind at ease.

Gus: So, you think she's safe? You think 
she's okay?

Harley: I think that you should go back out there and do your job and let me 
stay here and take care of your sister. At least for the night.

Gus: Oh, honey, this is what I love about you. You're amazing, you know. When I 
think about all she put you through when she first came to town. It means a lot 
to me, that's all I'm saying.

Harley: She's not a bad person, your sister. She's just made bad choices. I am 
trying to help her get out from under them.

Gus: I thought she... I thought she was out 
from under them.

Harley: Yeah. And I want her to enjoy what's 
happening to her now. I want her to be happy.

Gus: I've got to get going. I'll see you at 
home.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Eden: I'm sorry. I'm sorry you had to lie to 
him again.

Harley: No, no, no. That's the way it has to 
be, for now. But he will find out, Eden. Soon.
Eden: I know.

Harley: You crossed Vinnie Salerno. There 
will be consequences.

Salerno: I got to say, you got guts, kid, 
coming to me like this, defending Eden’s honor.

Bill: Well, look, I don't need to defend anything. I just want you to know that 
your dealings with Eden, they are all in the past.

Salerno: Yeah. Well, it's true Eden and I do go way back. And there was a time 
when I had real feelings for her, but I'll tell you something, man. Whatever 
feelings I had for her are long gone.
Bill: Yeah?
Salerno: The chick's of no use to me anymore.
Bill: Well, let's just keep it that way.

Salerno: Listen, I've got to take care of a couple of things. My associates will 
show you out. Gentlemen, before Mar. Lewis leaves, make sure you give him one of 
my business cards. Like I said, I respect you, kid, but nobody comes on my turf 
telling me what I can and cannot do. Tony, come on.
Tony: I'm sorry, Bill.
Bill: Yeah. (Grunts)
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Danny: What did you tell him?

Michelle: I told him that his Aunt Mel was taking him and his cousins to visit 
his uncle mike. And I said it was all part of this game that we're playing.
Danny: Good.

Michelle: I just tried to make it sound fun, 
you know? Like a big adventure. Danny? How long?

Danny: (Sighs) I don't know, honey. Let's 
not... not long. It's not. It's not going to be long.

Michelle: I could look into, you know, like a 
day camp. I just had so many plans for me and Robbie.

Danny: Okay, listen. Let's just take it a day 
at a time. Okay? It's not going to be forever. It's not. Hey, champ.
Michelle: Here he is.

Danny: You going to carry that down by 
yourself?
Michelle: Wow.

Danny: All right, let's see. Look at you. What a little man. Carrying that big 
bag all by yourself. Let me see those muscles. Let me see. Let me see. Make a 
muscle for me. Let me see. Ugh! Ugh!

Michelle: So, are you excited? Because I sure am. You're going to go with your 
Aunt Mel and your cousins on a big adventure with baby Leah and Jude.

Danny: And hey, you've got to remember to look out for your cousins, right, 
because you're bigger and older than them.

Michelle: Yeah. And then you're going to visit your uncle mike, you know? And 
he's going to take you to so many cool places. He's going to take you to the 
Washington monument, the white house.
Danny: Ooh.
Robbie: When will I see you again?
Michelle: Soon, honey.
Danny: Soon.

Michelle: Really soon. You know, and your mommy and daddy are going to call you. 
We're going to call you every morning when you wake up.
Danny: Yeah. Every morning.

Michelle: We're going to call you before you 
go to bed at night.
Danny: We're going to call you all the time.

Michelle: Because we love you so much. You 
know that, right?
Danny: Okay.
Michelle: Love you. (Horn honks)

Danny: There's your Aunt Mel. Are you excited? Are you ready? Yeah? Okay. Give 
me a hug. Give me a hug. I love you, champ.
Robbie: I love you.
Danny: Okay.

Michelle: You know you mean everything to us, 
right? You know that? Everything. Everything.

Danny: Okay, come on. Let's go. You want to 
get it?
Michelle: Oh, you got it by yourself?
Danny: He wants to do it.

Michelle: Okay. You're a big boy, huh? All 
right, let's go.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Sandy: You know, Josh, I never get tired of 
looking at these pictures.

Josh: Well, we are planning on taking a new full-family photo at the wedding and 
add to our collection here, so I'm expecting you to be front and center.

Sandy: Well, I'm not a front and center kind of guy, but I must admit, I 
wouldn't mind being in a big family photo. It's been fun being part of a real 
family.

Josh: Fun? When I was your age, I was doing everything I could to get away from 
my family. It wasn't that I didn't love them; it was just that they were a 
pretty overwhelming bunch of people. And of course, I was trying to find my own 
way in the world.

Sandy: Yeah. You see? I always thought finding your own way was a little 
overrated. I guess everyone wants what they don't have.
Shayne: Hey, sandman! A little help here!
Sandy: Oh, that's my cue.
Josh: Sandman?
Shayne: Thanks for nothing, Sparky.

Sandy: Oh, well, it looks like you've got it 
all under control, hot shot.

Josh: Okay, all right. You girls want to 
stick around for dinner? Your mom's going to be home soon.

Shayne: No, not this time. We've got to get 
this stuff over to Fifth Street.

Sandy: Yeah. Do you want us to take Eden and 
bill's gift?

Josh: No, no, no. That's all right. I left a 
message for them. I figure he'll stop by here himself later on today.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Tony: Enough, enough, enough. Back off. Get inside. Go on. Go on. Get inside. 
Go. All right, bill. Get up. I warned you. Didn't I? I warned you not to do it, 
right? Didn't I? Hm?

Bill: Yeah, I'm surprised you didn't take a 
few shots yourself.

Tony: Listen to me. Listen to me. You and 
Eden, you stay away.
Bill: No.

Tony: All right? Next time, you're not going 
to be so lucky.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Olivia: I just wanted to make sure it looked 
its best.

Phillip: Well, it's good to see it back 
around your throat, where it belongs.

Olivia: This is nice, you know? My husband is 
coming to visit me on my dinner break.

Phillip: Just like a normal married old 
couple.

Olivia: (Laughs) yeah. So, you mentioned some business earlier. Why don't we 
talk about that and get it out of the way, and then we can relax and enjoy each 
other.
Phillip: You're so practical.
Olivia: What's on your mind?

Phillip: Okay. Well, even though I've been steering clear of the office, I've 
been calling in at least once a day, keeping an eye on things, speaking to 
people, management, staff. And your name just keeps coming up. People can't say 
enough nice things about you and what a great job you're doing in my absence.
Olivia: Really?
Phillip: You seem surprised.

Olivia: (Laughs) yeah. I mean, I think I'm 
doing a good job but I know that people can find me a little...
Phillip: Cold?
Olivia: Uh-huh.
Phillip: Calculating?
Olivia: Mm-hmm.

Phillip: Well, sometimes that's what it takes to get the job done, and you 
certainly have. You made a lot of changes, haven't you?
Olivia: They needed to be made.

Phillip: And you had the power to make them, once you got my seat on the board. 
How did you ever get Alan and Alexandra to agree to that?

Olivia: Well, they didn't agree, but they 
didn't have any choice once you gave me your approval.
Phillip: Oh. I gave you my proxy. Right.

Olivia: Well, you didn't trust Alan and 
Alexandra to handle things properly, so you wanted me to be in control.

Phillip: Yeah. It's just... it's so strange, because I have... I don't have a 
single recollection of a discussion like that.
Olivia: Hm.

Phillip: But I'm glad I did, because as I 
said, it seems like you're doing a super job. What sounds good tonight?
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Gus: Bill! What happened?

Bill: Hey. Hey, uh, some guy jumped me, tried 
taking my wallet.

Gus: All right, well, you give me a description and I'm going to call it in and 
I'm also going to call you an ambulance.

Bill: (Slurring words) no, no, Gus. Please. I 
want to forget about it. I got to go. I got...

Gus: Wait, wait, wait. Wait. A punk jumps you 
in the alley and... this wasn't a punk, was it?
Bill: What?
Gus: Salerno did this to you, right?

Bill: What? Why would you say... no. Where 
would you get that from?

Gus: Because we're standing outside his silly little social club, right? Eden's 
scared of him. What, did you go try to straighten him out or something?
Bill: Something like that, yeah.

Gus: Uh-huh. Ridiculous, you know that? I 
heard a rumor somewhere you were a smart guy.

Bill: Look, he's got Eden rattled and I don't know why, Gus. All right? Someone 
has got to get this guy to back off. All right?

Gus: Is that supposed to be you? I'm 
surprised you're still breathing.

Bill: Look, he admitted to me that he had a thing for your sister once, okay? 
But he told me that he had no use for her anymore. That he's not interested. I 
don't know.
Gus: Why would he do this to you? Hm?

Bill: I don't know, Gus. I don't know. But I'll tell you something: If this is 
the price I've got to pay to get this pig out of her life...

Gus: Whatever. Look, I'm taking you to the 
hospital. Let's go. We're gong to the hospital.
Bill: No, Gus, I'm not going to the hospital.
Gus: Come on.
Bill: No, I'm not going. Please. Just...

Gus: Well, you can't just go... you can't go 
home looking like this.

Bill: I know. I'm going to go somewhere and clean myself up, all right? But 
don't you tell anyone that this happened.
Gus: You love my sister, don't you?
Bill: More and more everyday.

Gus: Salerno said he was going to lay off 
her?
Bill: Yeah.
Gus: You believe him?
Bill: Yeah. I do.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Michelle: Oh, no.
Danny: What?
Michelle: Robbie forgot his favorite truck.
Danny: Honey, it's okay.
Michelle: Danny, he's going to be so upset.

Danny: We'll send it to mike first thing 
tomorrow. We will. Michelle? We need to go over something.
Michelle: How long has that been there?

Danny: A while. A while. It's just in case. Michelle, I need you to look at me. 
Now, let's load it. This is the safety, right here. (Telephone ringing) I don't 
think you're going to have to use it, but just... you need to know how it works. 
Hello?
Salerno: Time's up, Daniel.

Danny: I've got to get back to Vinnie. I'm 
sorry.
Michelle: Right now?

Danny: Yeah. We have some business that we 
need to finish up tonight. I'm sorry.
Michelle: Danny?
Danny: What?

Michelle: You know that you can tell me 
anything, right?

Danny: Yeah. Honey, there's nothing for you 
to worry about. There's nothing to tell.

Michelle: Oh, Danny. Look, whatever you're dealing with... all right, just know 
that I'm going to be here when you get home.

Danny: That's what keeps me going. Put that 
away.
ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Olivia: Well, Emma loves the rattle that you 
bought her. In fact, I think it's her favorite toy.

Phillip: Speaking of Emma, I'd like to make a toast. Here's to you, for being 
smart enough to get me to sign my proxy over to you. You voted it very wisely so 
far. (Glasses clink)

Olivia: I'm lost. How did we get from talking 
about our daughter to your proxy?

Phillip: Because she is our daughter and she's the most important thing that we 
share. But because of her, we share so many other things, on so many levels. Our 
interests really are the same, aren't they?
Olivia: Absolutely.

Phillip: Good. I think it's important we 
remember that in the coming months.
Olivia: Because?

Phillip: Well, because we're both going to be working at Spaulding, and you 
know, even if we agree about many things, we're bound to have a difference of 
opinion now and then. But I think as long as we remember everything we have in 
common, we'll be okay.
Olivia: Well, I agree 100%.

Phillip: Good. Because, you know, when we're 
good together...
Olivia: We're the best.
Phillip: Cheers.
Olivia: Cheers. (Glasses clink)

Phillip: That necklace really does look perfect on you. All those diamonds. 
(Laughs) for all the years we'll have together.

Olivia: That sounds wonderful. You know what? 
I should get back to work.
Phillip: So soon?

Olivia: The sooner I finish my work, the 
sooner I can get home to you.
Phillip: I'll walk you out.

Bill: Hey. It's me.
Eden: Bill? Where are you?

Bill: I ran into your old friend, Vinnie 
Salerno.
Eden: My god. Did he go looking for you?
Bill: No. I went looking for him.
Eden: You what? Are you crazy?

Bill: Yeah, I am crazy in love with you.   
Anyway, I'm fine. Vinnie and I had a little chat.
Eden: You had a chat?

Bill: Mm-hmm, yeah. He admitted that he had a thing for you once but he's past 
that now. He won't be bugging you ever again.
Eden: He actually said that?

Bill: In so many words. He's out of your 
life, babe. He's out of our life together-- forever.
Eden: Are you coming home soon?
Bill: Yeah, soon. Soon. Eden, I love you.
Eden: I love you, too.

Bill: It's smooth sailing from here on out. 
Wedding bells here we come, huh? I'll see you in a while.
Harley: Is everything okay with Bill?
Eden: Seems so. Yeah.

Harley: Well, where is he? What has he been 
doing, Eden? (Knocking at door)

Gus: I'm looking for some answers. You told me that Eden wasn't in any way

Harley: Lying?

Gus: Yeah. Lying. I think she's in danger, I think you know about it, and I

me what is going on!
